issue.title: [CF 969] single square bracket [ is not auto-corrected to ["["]
issue.body:
What steps will reproduce the problem?

tried to create a custom text label for an icon that will show just the open square bracket character on the second line
(to remind me what keyboard button is assigned for that function)

What do you expect to happen? What happens instead?
expected output: the [ chraracter appears on the icon. I get "syntax error" instead.

i tried:
"[" - got error
\[ - got error
"\[" - got error
'[' - got error
'\[' - got error

What version of TellMeWhen are you using? ("The latest" is not a version)
v7.0.2

Do you have an error log of what happened?
not applicable

Please provide any additional information below:

after poking around i discovered that the interface auto-corrects ] to ["]"] and i figured that the correct syntax for what i want is ["["]...however this is not auto-corrected by the configurator when pressing the Okay button and "syntax error" appears instead of the single bracket.
Is this the intended behaviour?


> Posted by CurseForge user Adrian_G2 | Imported from CurseForge issue #969 | Raw

comments.body:
A closing bracket will autocorrect because it is easy to determine that an opening bracket was never paired with it, and it can also be assumed that someone would never type a lone closing bracket without meaning anything else. A closing bracket only has special meaning when it is paired with an opening bracket.

An opening bracket doesn't get autocorrected because it immediately gets interpreted as being the start of a tag sequence, and if there is nothing following that then it is indeed a syntax error.

I will add in some code to manually correct a single opening bracket. Anything besides exactly that will not be autocorrected, though (since its DogTag's parser that corrects these things, not TMW).


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras
